subject: Re: [junit] Need Info
msgSnippet: ... Sounds Like Homework To Me, But: There are more than 4000 unit tests in the Jena testsuite. I invite you to consider the consequences of (trying to) run
messageBody:
On Wednesday 11 May 2005 13:39, Mamata V Hegde wrote:
> Hi All,
> I have a question
> Could any one please answer for this ??
>
> Why Do we go For Automation during Unit Testing?

Sounds Like Homework To Me, But:

There are more than 4000 unit tests in the Jena testsuite. I invite
you to consider the consequences of (trying to) run them manually.

--
Chris "well, maybe some/lots are really acceptance tests" Dollin
"The compiler is free to insert padding because it makes the struct
look bigger and scares away predators." [Keith Thompson, comp.lang.c]
